SEARCH
Module LabAssignment
Package boundary

Class CareerCenterStaffView

java.lang.Object
boundary.CareerCenterStaffView
public class CareerCenterStaffView extends Object
View class for Career Centre Staff interactions. Handles the display of the staff menu and processes menu selections for authorizing representatives, approving internships, and managing requests.

  • Constructor Details

    • CareerCenterStaffView

      public CareerCenterStaffView()
      Constructs a new CareerCenterStaffView.

  • Method Details

    • promptMainMenu

      public int promptMainMenu()
      Displays the main menu and prompts the user for a selection. Validates input and returns a valid option (0-4).
      Returns:
      The selected menu option as an integer.

    • listCompanyReps

      public void listCompanyReps(List<CompanyRep> reps)
      Displays a formatted list of Company Representatives. Shows details such as User ID, Company, Department, and Authorization status.
      Parameters:
      reps - The list of company representatives to display.

    • listInternships

      public void listInternships(List<Internship> list)
      Displays a formatted list of Internships. Shows details such as Title, Level, Slots, and Visibility status.
      Parameters:
      list - The list of internships to display.

    • listWithdrawalRequests

      public void listWithdrawalRequests(List<Application> apps)
      Displays a formatted list of Applications that have requested withdrawal. Shows details such as Application ID, Student ID, and Internship Title.
      Parameters:
      apps - The list of applications to display.

    • promptIndexSelection

      public int promptIndexSelection(int max)
      Prompts the user to select an index from a list. Input is validated to ensure it is a number within the valid range (1 to max).
      Parameters:
      max - The maximum valid index (size of the list).
      Returns:
      The 0-based index selected by the user.

    • promptApproveOrReject

      public String promptApproveOrReject()
      Prompts the user to make an Approve or Reject decision.
      Returns:
      "approve" if user enters 'a', or "reject" if user enters 'r'.

    • show

      public void show(String msg)
      Displays a generic message string to the console.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to display.
